summary: This document is a police incident report detailing the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's activities, including the execution of search warrants at his residence in Palm Beach. It includes accounts from various witnesses and victims regarding their interactions with Epstein, as well as evidence collected during the investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the primary subject of the investigation, accused of soliciting underage girls for sexual activities.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Rodriguez provided testimony about his employment with Epstein and the activities that occurred at Epstein's residence.

persons.name: Daliah Weiss
persons.context: Weiss was involved in the prosecution of Epstein and communicated about subpoenas and the Grand Jury process.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Maxwell is mentioned as having recruited individuals to work for Epstein and was involved in the operations at his residence.

persons.name: Douglas Schoettle
persons.context: Schoettle was present during the execution of the search warrant at Epstein's residence.

persons.name: Joseph Recarey
persons.context: Recarey is the detective reporting on the investigation and documenting the evidence collected.

persons.name: Paul A Lavery
persons.context: Lavery is mentioned in connection with phone records and as a contact for the investigation.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: Dershowitz is mentioned as Epstein's attorney and involved in discussions regarding the case.

persons.name: Theresa Wyatt
persons.context: Wyatt is mentioned in connection with the investigation and subpoenas.

persons.name: David Rodgers
persons.context: Rodgers is identified as Epstein's pilot and provided information about his employment.

connections.description: Rodriguez was employed by Epstein as a houseman and had knowledge of the activities at Epstein's residence.
Maxwell was associated with Epstein and involved in recruiting individuals for his activities.
Weiss is the prosecutor handling the case against Epstein.
Rodriguez provided testimony to Recarey regarding his experiences while working for Epstein.
Rodgers is employed by Epstein as his pilot.

events.title: Execution of Search Warrant
events.description: A search warrant was executed at Epstein's residence in Palm Beach, leading to the collection of various items as evidence.

events.title: Grand Jury Testimony
events.description: The Grand Jury convened to hear testimonies related to the case against Epstein.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein turned himself in to authorities following the Grand Jury's indictment.

locations: 457 Madison Ave, New York City, New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is accused of soliciting underage girls for sexual activities.
Alfredo Rodriguez testified about the activities and environment at Epstein's residence.
The investigation involved multiple search warrants and the collection of evidence, including photographs and personal items.
The Grand Jury returned a true bill for Felony Solicitation of Prostitution against Epstein.
There were reports of intimidation against witnesses involved in the case.
